page.title: 15RAYMENTS BREWERY
page.content: Rayment's Brewery was built in l860 although there has been a brewery in the area for hundreds of years. The present Brewery employs 57 people and owns 20 properties in the village where employees live. Green King took over the Brewery but they still brew Pelham Ales on the site and there is a warehouse storing bottled alchohol and soft drinks. The buildings comprise an office block, brewery, keg store and warwhouse. Water is obtained from an artesian well underneath the brewery. All the employees live locally even the managers. There are eight large lorries and two small ones delivering over an area which extends south as far as the Thames.
